prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular metal bracket with two holes on opposite sides** **1.1 Coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0156, 0.0] **1.2 Sketch** Create a sketch on the plane defined by the new coordinate system. The sketch should contain four faces, each with one or more loops. *Face 1:* *Loop 1:* This loop consists of five curves: four lines and one arc. The curves are ordered sequentially as follows: * Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.3427], End Point: [0.292, 0.0356] * Arc 1: Start Point: [0.292, 0.0356], Mid Point: [0.375, 0.0], End Point: [0.458, 0.0356] * Line 2: Start Point: [0.458, 0.0356], End Point: [0.75, 0.3427] * Line 3: Start Point: [0.75, 0.3427], End Point: [0.75, 0.5823] * Line 4: Start Point: [0.75, 0.5823], End Point: [0.0, 0.5823] * Line 5: Start Point: [0.0, 0.5823], End Point: [0.0, 0.3427] This loop forms the outer perimeter of the bracket. *Loop 2:* This loop consists of one circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.1406, 0.4781] * Radius: 0.0833 This loop forms the first hole in the bracket. *Loop 3:* This loop consists of one circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.375, 0.1146] * Radius: 0.0625 This loop forms the second hole in the bracket. *Loop 4:* This loop consists of one circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.6094, 0.4781] * Radius: 0.0833 This loop is not used in the final shape but is present in the intermediate CAD model. **1.3 Extrusion** After creating the sketch, extrude it to generate the 3D model. Use the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0078 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0078 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body The resulting 3D model will have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 m * Width: 0.0156 m * Height: 0.75 m This completes the instructions for the first part of the CAD assembly.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** * The height is approximately twice the width. * The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.105, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. The sketch should have a single face (face_1). * On this face, draw a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 lines: 1. line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.15, 0.0] 2. line_2: Start Point [0.15, 0.0], End Point [0.15, 0.75] 3. line_3: Start Point [0.15, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] 4. line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.105 units along the normal direction to create a 3D model. **Part 2: Modify the previously constructed prism** 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector: [0.0225, 0.0, 0.03]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. The sketch should have a single face (face_1). * On this face, draw a loop (loop_1) consisting of 4 lines: 1. line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.105, 0.0] 2. line_2: Start Point [0.105, 0.0], End Point [0.105, 0.3] 3. line_3: Start Point [0.105, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.3] 4. line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Subtract the new 3D sketch from the existing prism to modify its dimensions, with the depth of subtraction being 0.075 units along the opposite direction of the normals. This reveals a new surface inside the prism.</description>
